pages.title: Beam Staff
pages.text: The <item>Beam Staff/$ is a handheld tool that allows creating and shooting <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$ at blocks or entities on the fly.$(br2)The <item>beam staff/$ uses 4 hotkeys that are unbound by default. Make sure to go into keybinds and, under 'Crossroads', bind the 4 <thing>$(l:intro/beam)primary alignment/$ control

keys. There is one for <thing>$(l:beam/energy)energy/$, <thing>$(l:beam/potential)potential/$, <thing>$(l:beam/stability)stability/$, and <thing>$(l:beam/void)void/$.$(br2)While holding the <item>beam staff/$, the currently setting for what <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beam/$ it fires is shown in the top left of the screen. Pressing or holding any of the 4 <thing>$(l:intro/beam)primary alignment/$ control keys will <em>increase/$ the setting for that <thing>$(l:intro/beam)alignment/$, while holding shift while pressing the <thing>$(l:intro/beam)primary alignment

<thing>$(l:intro/beam)/$ control key will <em>decrease/$ the setting for that <thing>$(l:intro/beam)alignment/$.$(br2)Right-clicking with the <item>beam staff/$ will fire a <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beam/$ of the set composition in the direction aimed. This beam has a range of 64 blocks. Holding down right-click will fire a continuous beam instead of a pulse.$(br2)The <item>beam staff/$ drains the

fired <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$ from a <item>$(l:technomancy/cage)beam cage/$, which is required for the <item>staff/$ to work, and must be in either the offhand or a baubles slot (if Curios is installed).$(br2)
